params._deadline: Transaction will revert after this deadline
params._to: Address that receive the lp token, normally the user himself

returns.amountA: Amount of tokenA to be input
returns.amountB: Amount of tokenB to be input

addLiquidityWithUSD(address,address,uint.details: Only difference with addLiquidity is that mintPolicyTokenForUser

params._deadline: Transaction will revert after this deadline
params._to: Address that receive the lp token, normally the user himself

params._amountAMin: Minimum amount of tokenA given out
params._amountBMin: Minimum amount of tokenB given out
params._liquidity: The lptoken amount to be removed

renounceOwnership().details: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner,         thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

returns.amountOut: Amounts to be really given out

returns.amountIn: Amounts to be really put in

transferOwnership(address).details: Can only be called by the current owner.

addLiquidityWithUSD(address,address,uint.notice: Add liquidity but only provide stablecoins

owner().notice: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().notice: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call         `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.

setBuyerToken(address).notice: Set the address of buyer token

transferOwnership(address).notice: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`).

userdoc.notice: Router for the pool, you can add/remove liquidity or swap A for B.         Swapping fee rate is 2% and all of them are given to LP.         Very similar logic with Uniswap V2.
